_header: Chronicles and annual books of kings
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 313; cf. prose chronicle in Bodl. Rolls (SC 2986), roll.
_description: House of Percy: Metrical Chronicle by William Peeris — in rhyme royal stanzas

BodDod50.First Lines:
Chronickles & Annuall bookes of KingesOf Ancient Lordes &
                    estatos royall…
BodDod50.Last Lines:
…Ingram Pearcy the second the third sone which hath graces
                    manifouldgod grant them to bee his seruantes good men &
                    ould
BodDod50.Attributed Title:
Here followeth þe Coppy of an ould Parchment booke deuided into Seauen
                    lines & Seauen of the Pedegrees liues & Deathes of the Percies from
                    fower discents afore the Conquest to þe Earles sone þat was kild by
                    the Commons at Thirsk in Henry the vij-th his tyme. It is in ffolio &
                    conteines eight leaues of Parchement wherof the first word is (here) and the
                    first letter beeinge (H) is a greate Red letter & is in length from þe
                    ffirst line to the Seauenth line. Now followeth þe booke conteininge 76
                    Deuisions of Seuen lines. Here beginneth the Prologue of this litle treatis
                    followinge which is þe discent of the Lord Percies made & compiled
                    briefely be mee Willam Peeris Clerce & Priest. Secretary to the Right noble
                    Earle Henry the v-th Earle of the Northumberland (f. 119); Hitherto are the
                    wordes of the aforede Parchment booke truly copied ffinis Historia
                        Perciorum (f. 128rb)
BodDod50.Editions:
B[esly],  John. 
             A Collection of Antiquarian Tracts relating to the North of
                England.
         Newcastle: Richardson, 1845; repr. 1847: 1.9.

BLRoy18Dii.First Lines: Cronykillis And annuall bookis of kinges.Of Auncient lordes and estates Riall.Declarithe the discent withe many notable thingis.Their ffatall endes and theire actes marshall.…
BLRoy18Dii.Last Lines: …Beholde and consyder the honorable discente.Of this v.thErle marke it wele in dede.His progenytoures in youre mynde yf that ye enprente.It shall appere clere And also Evidente.That descendid he is of þe noble blode of Inglande.Lancasters marches Arundell & Westmorlande.
BLRoy18Dii.Attributed Author: …william peeris clerke & preste secretory to the right nobill Erle henry the vth. Erle of Northumbrelande. (f. 186)
BLRoy18Dii.Attributed Title: Here begynnethe the prolouge of this litle treatyse folowinge whiche is the discente of the lorde percis made and compilede breuely by me william peeris clerke & preste secretory to the right nobill Erle henry the vth. Erle of Northumbrelande. (f. 186)

Digital Facsimile of British Library MS Royal 18 D II.
         2015; http://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?ref=Royal_MS_18_D_II.

Alnwick79.Attributed Title: a tretes of the noble pedegrew of the lords perses

Alnwick82.Note:
651 lines in couplets, 11-line stanzas, Monk’s Tale stanzas, and
                    rhyme royal.
Alnwick82.Attributed Title:
tretice…of the descente of the lordes percis maid and compiled by me
                    William Perrs clerke and secretary to the right noble erle Henry of
                    northumberland (f. 1)
